articles.title: PM Modi Embarks on Three-Nation Visit to Jordan, Ethiopia, Oman
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi began a three-nation diplomatic tour to Jordan, Ethiopia, and Oman on December 15. The visit aims to strengthen bilateral ties and discuss regional cooperation. It marks a key outreach in India's foreign policy amid global developments.[1][2]

articles.title: Dense Fog Disrupts Over 75 Flights in Delhi NCR
articles.summary: Dense fog gripping Delhi NCR disrupted over 75 flights, with 40 cancellations affecting IndiGo and Air India operations on December 15 daytime. Visibility issues led to widespread delays at major airports. Authorities urged passengers to check updates.[1]

articles.title: India Rejects Bangladesh Allegations on Sheikh Hasina
articles.summary: India's MEA firmly rejected Bangladesh interim government's claims that New Delhi allows former PM Sheikh Hasina to make incendiary statements on December 15. India reaffirmed support for free, fair elections in Bangladesh. The response underscores India's non-interference stance.[2]

articles.title: NIA to File Chargesheet in Pahalgam Terror Attack
articles.summary: The National Investigation Agency plans to file a chargesheet in the Pahalgam terror attack case before a special court on December 15. The move follows probe revelations linking external elements. It advances justice in the high-profile incident.[1]

articles.title: Supreme Court to Hear IndiGo Plea on Fog Disruptions
articles.summary: The Supreme Court is set to hear IndiGo's plea seeking judicial intervention over flight disruptions due to dense fog in Delhi NCR on December 15. The airline cited operational challenges from weather. Hearing addresses aviation sector concerns.[1]

articles.title: India Initiates Process to Ratify High Seas Treaty
articles.summary: India began preparing a domestic framework to ratify the High Seas Treaty on December 15, ahead of its entry into force on January 17, 2026. The treaty aims to protect marine biodiversity beyond national jurisdictions. This supports global ocean conservation efforts.[3]

articles.title: US Expands H-1B Vetting Delaying Indian Applicants to 2026
articles.summary: From December 15, the US Department of State expanded online presence reviews for all H-1B applicants, delaying Indian visa interviews to summer 2026. The new vetting impacts thousands of skilled workers from India. It tightens scrutiny on employment visas.[4]

articles.title: NESTS Organises Principals’ Conclave for Eklavya Schools
articles.summary: National Education Society for Tribal Students will hold a two-day Principals’ Conclave in Delhi on December 16-17, announced on December 15. The event strengthens leadership in Eklavya Model Residential Schools. It focuses on tribal education improvements.[2]
